meanings.definition: A promontory on the coast of Cornwall, England, also known as Dodman Point.
meanings.english_definition: A promontory on the coast of Cornwall, England, also known as Dodman Point.

etymology.value: The origin of the surname is likely topographic, referring to someone who lived near a rounded hill or a boundary marker. The place name 'Dodman Point' likely has similar origins, possibly referring to a landmark or boundary.
